news_header: Colombian President Gustavo Petro requested resignations from several Cabinet members after criticizing their performance on national television.
news_original_title: Colombia's Petro calls for Cabinet ministers to resign
news_text: Colombian President Gustavo Petro asked members of his Cabinet to resign following a five-hour criticism of their performance on national television. He stated that some ministers were lagging in delivering major projects. By Sunday night, three ministers and two senior officials had resigned. Labor Minister Gloria Ramirez and Environment Minister Susana Muhamad were among those who stepped down, with Muhamad citing objections to the appointment of Armando Benedetti, who is under investigation for illegal campaign financing and violence. The Cabinet changes aim to enhance compliance with the people's program.
